description: Comprehensive examples with 13 cases per stage covering diverse traffic scenarios

deconstruct.input_text: if Ego vehicle in front of other vehicle then it must not brake suddenly without a compelling reason.
deconstruct.reasoning: Two vehicle objects with relational predicate in_front_of. Conditional prohibition of sudden braking.

deconstruct.input_text: At intersections and junctions, ego must yield to vehicles coming from right side of ego, provided there is no traffic sign number 306 in front of ego.
deconstruct.reasoning: Three objects (two vehicles, one traffic sign). Complex conditional with disjunction, conjunction, and negation.

deconstruct.input_text: If ego vehicle wants to overtake the other vehicle then it should use turn signals beforehand for t seconds.
deconstruct.reasoning: Past temporal constraint: action must be preceded by signal for t seconds. Uses P (past) operator.

deconstruct.input_text: The ego vehicle has to stop with respect to a stop sign (sign 206) before it enters the intersection at least for a duration of tslw in front of the associated stop line.
deconstruct.reasoning: Duration constraint with minimum time requirement. Three object types: vehicle, traffic sign, road marking.

deconstruct.input_text: ego shall not overtake another vehicle if a pedestrian crosswalk is in front of the other vehicle.
deconstruct.reasoning: Three objects including road feature (crosswalk). Prohibition based on spatial relationship.

deconstruct.input_text: if there is a traffic light on the ego lane and the traffic color is red, the ego vehicle shall not exceed the stop lane.
deconstruct.reasoning: Traffic control scenario with traffic light state. Conditional prohibition with multiple antecedents.

deconstruct.input_text: If ego vehicle wants to change lanes, turn, or overtake, they should use their turn signals beforehand for t seconds.
deconstruct.reasoning: Single object with multiple action disjunction. Past temporal constraint with time window.

deconstruct.input_text: ego vehicle will not exceed the speed limit of the lane it is driving on and it will not exceed the maximum velocity allowed for its vehicle type.
deconstruct.reasoning: Single object with multiple prohibition constraints. Unconditional conjunction of negations.

deconstruct.input_text: ego vehicle is on the road and there is a continuous line present on the road, then the ego vehicle must not cross or straddle the continuous line.
deconstruct.reasoning: Road marking object with multiple prohibited interactions. Conjunction of negated consequences.

deconstruct.input_text: If ego Vehicle is driving behind another vehicle then it must maintain a safe distance until ego can overtake the other vehicle safely.
deconstruct.reasoning: Until temporal pattern: condition must hold continuously until release condition. Two vehicles with relational predicates.

deconstruct.input_text: Within 5 to 10 seconds after sensor A detects a fault, alarm B must sound and continue for at least 20 seconds.
deconstruct.reasoning: Identify objects: SensorA (sensor), AlarmB (alarm). Extract atomic propositions with object-predicate structure. Map temporal and metric constraints.

deconstruct.input_text: if Ego vehicle in front of other vehicle then it must not brake suddenly without a compelling reason.
deconstruct.reasoning: Identify two vehicle objects: ego and other. The predicate in_front_of is a relational predicate between two objects. The conditional logic requires negation of sudden braking.

deconstruct.input_text: At intersections and junctions, ego must yield to vehicles coming from right side of ego, provided there is no traffic sign number 306 in front of ego.
deconstruct.reasoning: Identify three object types: ego vehicle, other vehicle, and traffic sign. Extract location-based predicates (at_intersection, at_junction) and relational predicates (in_right_of, in_front_of, yield). Complex conditional logic with multiple antecedents.

synthesize.input_text: If ego in front of other, then ego must not brake suddenly
synthesize.reasoning: Global always operator with conditional implication. Relational predicate in_front_of(ego,other) and unary predicate sudden_braking(ego).

synthesize.input_text: At intersection with vehicle on right and no sign 306, ego must yield
synthesize.reasoning: Complex antecedent with disjunction (intersection or junction), conjunction (vehicle on right), and negation (no sign). All predicates use object parameters.

synthesize.input_text: If ego wants to overtake other, it should use turn signals beforehand for t seconds
synthesize.reasoning: Past temporal operator P with time window [0,t]. Action must be preceded by signal within time window.

synthesize.input_text: At intersection with stop sign 206, ego must stop for at least tslw duration
synthesize.reasoning: Nested temporal operators: global always with bounded always G[0,tslw] for duration constraint. Traffic sign as parameter in predicate.

synthesize.input_text: If crosswalk in front of other vehicle, ego must not overtake
synthesize.reasoning: Three objects: ego, other, crosswalk. Relational predicates capture spatial relationships between all entities.

synthesize.input_text: With red traffic light and stop line ahead, ego shall not exceed stop line
synthesize.reasoning: Traffic control scenario with multiple conditions. Predicates explicitly reference traffic light and stop line objects.

synthesize.input_text: If ego changes lanes or turns or overtakes, turn signals must be active for t seconds before
synthesize.reasoning: Disjunction of multiple actions, all requiring same past temporal precondition. Single ego object with multiple action predicates.

synthesize.input_text: Ego must not exceed lane speed limit and must not exceed vehicle type speed limit
synthesize.reasoning: Conjunction of negated predicates for multiple simultaneous prohibitions. Both predicates use ego as parameter.

synthesize.input_text: With solid line present, ego must not cross or straddle the line
synthesize.reasoning: Road marking object with conditional prohibitions. Multiple negated consequences joined by conjunction.

synthesize.input_text: When ego behind other, maintain safe distance until ego can overtake
synthesize.reasoning: Until operator (U) expressing condition must hold continuously until release. All predicates explicitly reference both vehicle objects.

synthesize.input_text: Alarm sounds within 5-10 seconds after sensor fault and lasts for 20 seconds
synthesize.reasoning: Map atomic propositions to predicate(object) form: detects_fault(SensorA), sounds(AlarmB). Apply temporal operators: G for global, F_[5,10] for eventual within window, G_[0,20] for duration constraint.

synthesize.input_text: If ego in front of other, then ego must not brake suddenly
synthesize.reasoning: Use relational predicate in_front_of(ego,other) to capture the spatial relationship between two objects. Apply global operator G and negation ~ for prohibition.

synthesize.input_text: At intersection with vehicle on right and no sign 306, ego must yield
synthesize.reasoning: Combine multiple predicates with logical operators. Use disjunction (|) for intersection or junction, conjunction (&) for multiple conditions. All predicates use object parameters for clarity and traceability.

verify.output: Always, if the ego vehicle is in front of the other vehicle, then the ego vehicle must not brake suddenly.
verify.reasoning: Relational predicate in_front_of(ego,other) translates to spatial relationship between two vehicles. Negation becomes prohibition.

verify.output: Always, if ego is at an intersection or junction, and another vehicle is on the right side of ego, and sign 306 is not in front of ego, then ego must yield to the other vehicle.
verify.reasoning: Complex formula with disjunction (or), conjunction (and), and negation (not). Each predicate maps to clear spatial or action relationship.

verify.output: Always, if ego vehicle overtakes another vehicle, then ego must have used turn signals for t seconds beforehand.
verify.reasoning: Past operator P[0,t] translates to 'beforehand for t seconds'. Temporal precedence requirement.

verify.output: Always, if ego is at an intersection and at stop sign 206, then ego must remain in standstill for at least tslw duration.
verify.reasoning: Nested temporal operator G[0,tslw] translates to duration requirement. Traffic sign parameter (206) preserved in natural language.

verify.output: Always, if a pedestrian crosswalk is in front of another vehicle, then ego must not overtake that vehicle.
verify.reasoning: Three-entity relationship: crosswalk location relative to other vehicle determines ego's action. Prohibition expressed as 'must not'.

verify.output: Always, if the traffic light is red for ego and a stop line is in front of ego, then ego must not exceed the stop line.
verify.reasoning: Traffic control scenario with state condition (red light) and spatial condition (stop line position). Objects explicitly named in translation.

verify.output: Always, if ego vehicle changes lanes, or turns, or overtakes, then ego must have used turn signals for t seconds beforehand.
verify.reasoning: Disjunction of actions translates to 'or' connectives. Past temporal requirement applies to any of the actions.

verify.output: Always, ego must not exceed the lane speed limit and ego must not exceed the vehicle type speed limit.
verify.reasoning: Conjunction of negations translates to multiple simultaneous prohibitions joined by 'and'.

verify.output: Always, if a solid line is present on ego's lane, then ego must not cross the line and ego must not straddle the line.
verify.reasoning: Road marking condition leads to multiple prohibitions. Object (solid_line) explicitly referenced in both consequent predicates.

verify.output: Always, if ego is behind another vehicle, then ego must maintain safe distance from the other vehicle until ego overtakes the other vehicle.
verify.reasoning: Until operator (U) translates to 'until' expressing continuous requirement with eventual release condition. Both vehicles explicitly referenced.

verify.output: Always, if SensorA detects a fault, then within 5 to 10 seconds AlarmB will sound and continue for at least 20 seconds.
verify.reasoning: Interpret predicate(object) notation: detects_fault(SensorA) means SensorA performs the action of detecting fault. Temporal operators map to natural language time expressions.

verify.output: Always, if the ego vehicle is in front of another vehicle, then the ego vehicle must not brake suddenly.
verify.reasoning: Relational predicate in_front_of(ego,other) translates to spatial relationship. Negation ~ translates to prohibition 'must not'.

verify.output: Always, if ego is at an intersection or junction and another vehicle is on the right side of ego, then ego must yield to the other vehicle and there must not be sign 306 in front of ego.
verify.reasoning: Complex formula with multiple predicates. Logical operators (|, &, ~) map to natural language connectives (or, and, not). Each predicate explicitly references its objects.
